page.title: 03BEACH STUDY
page.content: There was a hypothesis"to prove that this stretch of coastline consisted mainly of long unspoilt sandy beaches" The coastline was divided into ten 300 metre long strips,each group had one strip.We were given a map,ten coastline sheets,2 metre rules and one 30 centimetre ruler.The coastline sheets were sheets on which we put what the 1 metre square was composed of eg sand etc.and how good it was. METHOD:We measured a metre square and recorded the amount of sand etc there was in it,and how much surface deposit there was.We did this in metre squares all over our area,doing near the sea first because of the tide. Was the hypothesis true? On the whole,no!There were some stretches of sandy beaches but not enough to say"mainly".All the shops,car-parks etc were by these sandy
